data.title: Organocatalytic Asymmetric Synthesis of Si-Stereogenic Silyl Ethers

paragraphs.context: Functionalized enantiopure organosilanes are important building blocks with applications in various fields of chemistry; nevertheless, asymmetric synthetic methods for their preparation are rare. Here we report the first organocatalytic enantioselective synthesis of tertiary silyl ethers possessing 'central chirality' on silicon.

qas.question: What is the significance of functionalized enantiopure organosilanes in chemistry?

answers.text: Important building blocks with applications in various fields of chemistry

qas.question: What is reported for the first time regarding the synthesis of silyl ethers?

answers.text: The first organocatalytic enantioselective synthesis of tertiary silyl ethers possessing 'central chirality' on silicon

paragraphs.context: The synthesis of silyl ethers was achieved using a newly developed imidodiphosphorimidate (IDPi) catalysts. DFT calculations were performed to gain insights into the high enantioselectivities observed.

qas.question: What catalysts were used in the synthesis of silyl ethers?
What was performed to understand the high enantioselectivities observed in the synthesis?
